moves.1. e4: I am annotated this game to ask others about the position and get feedback. The computer calls a set of moves near end of game a blunder. However, I purposely sacrificed a knight to gain a rook. Please comment on this and let me know your thoughts. Black resigned, so I really don't know how it would have turned out, but it didn't look good for black.
moves.1... e6: I like playing against this defense.
moves.2. d4: Looking for a strong center game.
moves.2... d5: Anticipated this move and appreciate the tension.
moves.4. Bg5: Pinned the knight, pretty standard so far
moves.4... h6: I prefer playing Be2 here as black. Otherwise, my king pawns get skewed and reduces the effectivity of a king side castle
moves.5. Bxf6: First blood! I don't mind the exchange and his only option is to double the pawns kingside. Notice black still has no minor pieces developed.
moves.5... gxf6 6. exd5: Was hoping to draw his queen out, but either wanted to open up the center.
moves.7. Qf3: I did think it was premature to bring the queen out, but I was eyeing the b7 pawn.
moves.7... c5: Mistake on blacks part. I think maybe he thought I would take and give him the center, but that would never happen.
moves.8. Nxd5: Things are setting nicely. I just need to coax his bishop out of position.
moves.8... f5: He moves to take his pawn out of harms way, but the cell he exited is still my knights target.
moves.9. Bb5+: Hoping he brings his bishop out.
moves.10. Nf6+: Ok, so I have his rook now and thinking this was pretty good. However, commuter analysis calls this move a blunder. Why?
moves.10... Qxf6: Really should have moved the king, but I don't think he sees the rook threat.
